Articles.Content: Yeah, this is the first time I encounter something like this too.

I'm back. Finals are over. Back to work on this.

I can work on fixing Tyrok.

As for the terrain, that is probably something wrong with Kopernicus. With previous version you could land and timewarp on the example "Hodor."

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T19:54:36Z" title="06/16/2015 07:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**
Including the ones in this mod?

After an hour of editing and testing... I've got nothing.

Anyone else wanna take a crack at it?

Also, the new example Hodor is broken, it changes the heightmap of the Mun to Kerbin's and sets the map texture as Gilly's.

**Nevermind**, I think I found the issue with Tyrok.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T22:00:04Z" title="06/16/2015 10:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**
What is? I'm really curious

I don't believe I'm following your train of thought, although, Hodor is one of the example planets provided with Kopernicus.

Now that I look at it, the Mun in general has the heightmap of Kerbin piled on top of the original one, even without Hodor.

I still can't figure out the issue with Tyrok, wasn't the oceans. Might be the PQS, or a spelling error I missed...

Oh, and **WELCOME!**

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T23:36:03Z" title="06/16/2015 11:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**
Thank you! :-)

Sadly, after about 6 hours of continuous headaches, I still haven't found a fix for Tyrok...

[Tyrok Pastebin Config](http://pastebin.com/1q3wuBTP)

Reverse-engineering and splicing configs yielded freezing at loading, so that won't work either. I might have to put this one aside and move on to fixing other things for now...
Also a TEMPLATE.

Copied the code for Tyrok: still can't find a solution...

Huh, this is gonna be fun...

Although, I feel as if templates aren't thoroughly needed in this version of Kopernicus.

I can't find a template in any of the configs anywhere, even by using Ctrl+F.

@Interplanet Janet, Templates are no longer needed and only tend to change things that we actually want. Kopernicus allows for almost full control of planet creation.

Planets can be built completely from scratch.

**Can I ask for a progress report from everyone? I've been gone for a while so I'm kinda lost on where we are in development**

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-17T16:06:58Z" title="06/17/2015 04:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 17, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**

Long story short...

-We rescaled Mysterio and its moons (Asterix is not rescaled for realistic purpose as a Trojan moon).

-Stuff clips through the surface of planets when you activate timewarp when landed.

-Kerbals somehow glitch-walk when trying to move on the surface of those worlds (as Nansucho has shown).

-Tyrok was rescaled and disappeared after the rescale and Gas giant atmosphere problem (could possibly be the Kopernicus Cache).

We need lots of stuff to be worked on...

Also, could someone upload a video on how Kerbals walk on the surface of these worlds - just for documentation purposes?

This is one of Nansucho's problems so far... besides Tyrok's mysterious disappearance.

Hey, stuff happens sometimes...

And if/when we fix it we will have a reference to the problem.

If you want, I can make a short video tomorrow and share it with you.

Btw, if you look at the Kerbal Engineer data on my screens, you'll see that it reports the Kerbal not landed, but "in space low". Maybe that's the reason for the sink during TimeWarping, as usually happens between two objects timewarped togheter.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-17T21:34:36Z" title="06/17/2015 09:34  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 17, 2015</time> by Nansuchao**
Huh, I do see that, you should share a video, just for documenting the problem in case this problem happens again.
No problem. Tomorrow in the morning I shall have some free time.

Sorry for the late, I was a little busy with RL. Here's a short video as promised:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EIubdS3GHx4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Btw, I noticed that every Astro's planets rotates really fast. It's not realistic for their position. Is it intended?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T13:41:10Z" title="06/18/2015 01:41  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Nansuchao**

Some planets have an intentional fast rotation (like Sirona), but I'm not so sure about Mina - that is a bit suspicious.

I think that we should lower the rotation of those worlds to a reasonable pace.

Yeah, I've got a feeling that after we fix the glitch we make science biome maps for the existing planets.
Great! I will help if needed. Any news on the fix for this issue?
I am realy angry about Tyrok tho! Wish me luck! The first part of my exam happens Moday!

I can fix the atmosphere of Mysterio, easy peasy. Just need to adjust the pressure settings and height.

As for Tyrok, could it be that it can't generate planets below a certain size with oceans? Testing now.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T22:26:57Z" title="06/18/2015 10:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**

Nope, adjusting the size of Tyrok didn't fix it.

MrHappyFace, do you still have the config from when you were first developing Phoop, I wanted to figure out color generation with noise and use the Phoop config as a base.

Also raised the rotation of several planets, didn't fix the glitch, trying to force a template now.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T23:56:54Z" title="06/18/2015 11:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ME_QDqGL87w?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

PROGRESS HAS BEEN ACHIEVED. GLITCH HAS BEEN MURDERED.

YAY! We have the technology!

Despite Tyrok not showing up (yet), we have already conquered one of the weirder glitches!

Anyway, When we set up biomes on Mina and other worlds, we need to make sure that every world is fixed.

We will get around to fixing Tyrok soon, but we does anyone have a tutorial on making singularities for Binary planets/bodies?

@Hammersamatom

Hooray! I'm happy you've been able to find the problem. You're right, I haven't the biome displayed. I thought it was cause there weren't biomes still.

That's what I believed too, but when I noticed the Slope wasn't being displayed, I threw the biome idea out the window.

Working on a procedural planet, I can't seem to get the colors and terrain to match...

@Astrofox, check out Amarius1's KerbolPlus for singularities, he has a couple.

(Because the KerbolPlus download hasn't been updated: [Download](https://github.com/Amarius1/Kerbol-Plus/releases/download/v.2.3.0/KerbolPlus.zip))

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T14:19:12Z" title="06/19/2015 02:19  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**
